title: Chattahoochee River National Recreation Area: Birds
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Animals     Birds                Birds                   Tufted Titmouse (Baeolophus bicolor)               Carolina Chickadee (Poecile carolinensis)               Bald Eagle (Haliaeetus leucocephalus)               Great Blue Heron (Ardea herodias)         Â    The Chattahoochee River National Recreation Area is home to over 190 species of birds, making it a popular site for birding. Whether following the river corridor as they migrate or nesting in the forest, birds of all shapes and sizes can be found within the park. For a list of birds found in the park visit the NPSpecies page. Make sure you select Chattahoochee River National Recreation Area (CHAT) and Birds in the drop down menus before clicking on the Search button. Once the list appears click on the Report/PDF button to print out a Species Checklist for the park. Click the links below for more information on our ten most common birds.  Tufted Titmouse Northern Cardinal Carolina Wren Carolina Chickadee Red-Eyed Vireo American Crow Blue Jay Red-Bellied Woodpecker Blue-Gray Gnatcatcher Downy Woodpecker
